descriptor.name: Study description
descriptor.value:
In this study we aim to assess the small RNAs binding to IAP retrotransposons in order to keep those sequences inactive. All the samples are genome-wide ligation based proximity samples, as described in these publications: Methods. 2012 Nov;58(3):268-76 and PLoS One. 2011;6(10):e26426.
These data are part of a pre-publication release. For information on the proper use of pre-publication data shared by the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute (including details of any publication moratoria), please see http://www.sanger.ac.uk/datasharing/

descriptor.name: Does this study contain samples that are contaminated with human DNA which must be removed prior to analysis?
Does this study require the removal of X chromosome and autosome sequence?
Does this study require y chromosome data to be separated from x and autosomal data before archival?
Abstract
descriptor.value: We will associate small RNA seq expression with IAP methylation and transcritpion changes in ES cells. IAPs are normally kept methylated in ES cells and only in Dnmt1 knock out ES cells this class of transposons is being demethylated (Arand et al., PLoS Genet, 8(6), June 2012). The same demethylation is happening in 2i conditions (Seisenberger et al., Molecular Cell, 48(6):849{862, December 2012). Dnmt1 conditional knockdown ES cells will be used for studying the demethylation and small RNA expression at different time points of Dnmt1 knockdown (Liu et al., Nat Commun, 4:1563, March 2013).
